title: Ex-boxer Ricky Hatton gives Paul Gascoigne character reference in court
text:
Boxing legend Ricky Hatton has given evidence in support of Paul Gascoigne (Picture: Getty/PA)

Ricky Hatton has defended his friend Paul Gascoigne in court.

The boxing legend claimed the former England footballer was a ‘tactile person’ in a statement read out during his trial at Teesside Crown Court for sexual assault.

Gascoigne is accused of trying to put his tongue down a woman’s throat after forcibly kissing her on the lips on a train from York to Durham on August 20, 2018.

But he denies the allegations and claims he was trying to boost the woman’s confidence with the kiss after she was called a ‘fat lass’.

Retired boxer Mr Hatton, who got to know Gascoigne over the years having first met at a charity event, said: ‘He is very tactile when he meets me, he rushes over and gives me a hug and sometimes kisses me on the cheek that is the way he has always been.’

Former England footballer Paul Gascoigne arrives at Teesside Crown Court in Middlesbrough (Picture: PA)

Gascoigne later cried as he defended himself on the witness stand.

He said the kiss had not been sexual, adding: ‘I get kissed all the time. If that’s the case I’ve been sexually harassed for the last 20 years.’

The defence produced images showing Gascoigne kissing celebrities in the past, including Princess Diana and Wayne Rooney.

His former agent Mel Stein also gave him a character reference.

Ricky Hatton defended Gascoigne in court (Picture: Getty)

In a statement read out in court, Mr Stein recalled the player greeting a rabbi’s wife with a hug and kiss at a bar mitzvah.

The player then apologised when he realised what he had done, and Mr Stein said the rabbi’s wife ‘made no objection’.

He said: ‘It is typical of the way Paul Gascoigne would greet people.’

Giving evidence over a videolink, former boxing champion Jane Couch said Gascoigne put his arms around her and gave her a kiss when they first met at a charity night she was hosting.

The defendant’s therapist, Bournemouth-based addiction specialist Paul Spanjar, also gave evidence via videolink, and said Gascoigne routinely greets him with a ‘hug and a kiss’.
description: Ricky Hatton has defended his friend Paul Gascoigne in court.
